main.commit_message:
bus/driver: send correct fd-count with credentials

Fix the GetConnectionCredentials() API to send the correct number of FDs
with a message. We have to predict the number of FDs since we write
message headers before their body. This should be fine to predict,
though.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/driver: extract credentials

Extract the credential-set into a structure to make it easier to pass
around. Maybe, at some point, we can even move it into Peer and Broker,
but keep it simple for now and just simplify the driver.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/driver: return ProcessFD via GetConnectionCredentials()

As per the new addition to the D-Bus spec, return the pid FD of the
connection via GetConnectionCredentials(). We only do so if we got the
FD from SO_PEERPIDFD, which is safe against recycle attacks.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/peer: properly fold error domains

Ensure that errors domains from src/util/ are properly folded. The
functions in question do not use any error-domains, but we should still
adhere to the style we use throughout.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

Store pid FD of peer/broker

It will be send out with other credentials.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(properly fold uncaught errors)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: fix SO_PEERPIDFD error code

The queued-patch for SO_PEERPIDFD regarding unsupported socket types has
changed the error code to ENODATA, so ensure that we adapt accordingly.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: detect reaped pidfds

Ensure that we correctly detect reaped pidfds returned by SO_PEERPIDFD.
This might change in the future, but until now this is a reliable error
code used by AF_UNIX.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

test/sockopt: fix stale-test for SO_PEERPIDFD

Fix the SO_PEERPIDFD test to test the pidfd for non-stale scenarios,
rather than stale. We have not decided on how to deal with stale pidfds
yet, so leave this undecided for now.

Reported-by: frkli1965
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

all: make use of misc_memfd()

Rather than open-coding the memfd syscalls, make use of the new
misc_memfd() helpers.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/misc: add memfd utilities

Add proper helpers around memfds. This includes a new memfd-constructor
that follows newest kernel standards around EXEC/NOEXEC handling.

Furthermore, add GET_SEALS and ADD_SEALS wrappers to avoid open-coding
them all over the place.

This does not make use of the new helpers, yet, but only adds tests to
verify their behavior.

Reported-by: Дамјан Георгиевски
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: add tests for SO_PEERPIDFD

Add a test that verifies the behavior of SO_PEERPIDFD depending on the
state of the originally pinned process.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: add helper to get pid FD from peer

New socket option added in kernel v6.5.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(Introduce SOCKOPT error domain; add documentation; change signature
 to use the error-domain rather than nullables)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/proc: add helper to resolve a pid file descriptor

A pid FD can be resolved by reading from proc's fdinfo

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(rework based on the new proc helpers)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/proc: add proc_read() helper

Add another proc-fs helper proc_read() which reads an entire proc-fs
file into memory. It is designed for virtual files of proc-fs and
follows the exact requirements of them.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/proc: add proc_field() extractor

Add a helper to extract an individual field from a proc-file. While at
it, add infrastructure for util/proc.c tests.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/proc: PROC_SELF -> PROC_PID_SELF

Use a more descriptive name for the self-pid.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

uti/string: add helper to wrap strtol()

Add helper to convert strings to `int`, alongside the existing
fixed-size integer converters.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(align error handling with the other parsers)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/syscall: add wrapper for pidfd_open()

Only present in glibc 2.36+ and no other libcs.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

dbus/socket: set msgheader controllen size using the right macro

Use CMSG_SPACE to set the size of msg_controllen when sending FDs.
CMSG_LEN was used implicicly before, which for 1 FD is 20 bytes,
while CMSG_SPACE is 24 bytes.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/fdlist: add helper to return list size

Provide a new helper to return the space occupied by a full FDList. This
includes trailing padding and is required for cmsg-based transactions.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(fix commit message)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/selinux: follow permissive mode

Make sure to follow the rules of enforcing/permissive mode and avoid
operation denials in permissive mode.

Reported-by: Daan De Meyer <daan.j.demeyer@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/selinux: provide helper to check enforcing mode

Add a new helper to check the selinux enforcing mode. This will be used
in follow-ups to avoid AVC denials in permissive mode.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/selinux: try opening the status page

Try opening the selinux status page for faster access to selinux status
values. If running on older kernels without the status page, simply
avoid using it.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

ci/meson-tests: add ubuntu run

Add another workflow run with ubuntu as container image, allowing us to
enable apparmor and test it.

Additionally, switch all other workflow runs over to the new
dbrk-ci-fedora image, to distinguish clearly between the base OS used in
each run.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/apprmor: fix sized vs unsized comparison

Use an unsigned iterator since we use it to count elements, and those
are unsigned integers in dbus-broker. This fixes a compiler warning
about comparing sized to unsized integers.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

ci/meson-tests: test fallback configuration

Add another test run which explicitly tests all the fallback
configurations.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

ci/meson-tests: enable SELinux where possible

Enable SELinux wherever possible, to increase test coverage. With the
fedora containers we can build it even on Ubuntu hosts. Runtime testing
will not be possible, though.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

ci/meson-test: document environments

Document the environments in the new meson-tests CI run. This explains
shortly what each environment tests and why the given flags are chosen.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

ci: add direct test workflow

Add a direct workflow that runs the meson based test suite with our
pre-defined environments.

In recent years, github-actions has acquired all the features we need,
and thus the c-util wrapper has lost significance. Rather than hiding
all the details, create a new alternative CI run that directly encodes
all the tests we require.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch/config: use AT_RANDOM for XML hash salt

Forward the entropy from AT_RANDOM to the hash-salt used by expat. Use
XML_SetHashSalt() for this (available and fixed since expat-2.1).

This fixes an issue where libexpat might read from `/dev/urandom` and
thus block until the entropy pool is initialized. This hidden
dependency is very hard to debug. Instead, we require the service
launcher to delay startup until suitable entropy is available. This
explicit dependency is much easier to manage, debug, and control.

Reported-by: Stefan Agner <stefan@agner.ch>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch/config: assert on expat initialization

Ensure the expat initialization did not indicate failure. With the
setup we use, there cannot be any failure, but ensure this is true in
case other setups end up being used in the future.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch/config: avoid expat.h in header

To reduce exposure of expat, avoid it in config.h. The only definition
we use can be easily forward-declared, and thus we can completely
contain expat in config.c.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/selinux: fix docs formatting

Fix the docs-formatting to use a new line for the function name and
abstract.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/apparmor: fix return value in apparmor_message_query()

Not all paths in apparmor_message_query() correctly set the return code.
Restructure the code to always return immediately on error, and then
return success unconditionally at the end. This follows our general
coding style and makes it easier to review.

Reported-by: Mark Esler <mark.esler@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/peer: fix catching OOM when linking match-rules

When the match-rule infrastructure was extended to have per-key lookup
tables, all call-sites had to be amended to catch errors when linking
new rules. One such site was missed, so fix this and catch the error
properly.

The conversion was initially performed in:

    commit 6c2b082522a6af033cd6699b669a4de614c41ad7
    Author: Tom Gundersen <teg@jklm.no>
    Date:   Wed Apr 25 17:16:47 2018 +0200

        match: make match_rule_link() fallible

This fixes a possible bug where ENOMEM is ignored and thus a match rule
is silently dropped instead of being linked and retained.

Reported-by: Mark Esler <mark.esler@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: update AUTHORS

Add recent additions to the author-list, and update the copyright
statement given employment status changes.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: prepare v33

Prepare the next release. Bump the version to v33, fill in the changelog
information and update the contributors page.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch/service: delay service-start

Delay the actual start of the systemd service until the correct matches
are installed. Otherwise, we might miss a PropertiesChanged signal,
because the scheduler happened to prefer scheduling all systemd jobs
before installing the D-Bus matches.

Reported-by: Stefan Agner <stefan@agner.ch>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: move watch-unit handling around

Move the service_watch_unit() handling down in service.c, preparing for
a change of the order the different handlers will be called.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: unify service_watch_unit() calls

Now that all data is cached on `Service`, we can unify the calls to
service_watch_unit() and move them into service_start().

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: drop unused error-path

We have no custom errors to return from service_activate(), so no reason
to forward them. Fold them into fatal errors and drop unused
error-handling since this is done during object teardown, anyway.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: order service-calls logically

Reorder the functions in service.c according to their definition in
service.h. Keep a logical order with object management first, then
followed by object calls grouped based on purpose.

This does not change any of the functions but merely moves them around.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: duplicate service-data for activation

Keep a duplicate ServiceData object during activation to ensure its
content does not change. Any parallel service-file reload operations
will thus merely update the data used on the next activation.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: group service-fields

The Service object is getting bigger, so group the individual fields
for easier introspection and debugging.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: keep service data in separate object

We retain all information from a service file in the Service object.
This data, however, might get updated when the service file is re-read.

Separate the service-data from the runtime management data of the
Service object by moving it into its own type. This makes it better
visible which data is updated at which point in time.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: retain active unit name

Store the name of the unit we spawned for activation in the service
object and retain it for as long as the activation is valid.
Additionally, remember whether this is a transient unit.

This fixes a bug where a unit-reload while an activation is pending
would possibly cause a change of the unit-name that is tracked. While
it is unclear whether a change of service-files during runtime is
supported, this at least fixes any possible runtime issues and correctly
delays the unit-name update for when the activation is retried.

This also prepares for planned reworks of the spawn-handling by
remembering the name of the unit that is tracked and thus allows delayed
activation after a match-rule has been established.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: move job-subscription to start-helper

Move the job-subscription invocation to the service_start() helper. This
subscription is tied to the Start[Transient]Unit() call and thus should
be called at the same time.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/service: extract service_start() operation

Extract the code that starts a service into a separate function. This
will later be called from a different context, so prepare the code to be
properly extracted into a callable.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/driver: introduce DRIVER_E_UNIMPLEMENTED for stubs

Introduce the new DRIVER_E_UNIMPLEMENTED error-code for stub functions.
This avoids returning EPERM to users and makes it easier to recognize.

Note that previously EPERM was used to keep compatibility to dbus-daemon
and avoid clients reacting to other error-codes. EPERM was a suitable
and reasonable way to emulate a possibly misconfigured bus, rather than
a custom error code. However, for the debug-calls this is definitely not
necessary and only a remnant of when less driver calls were supported.

Suggested-by: draconicfae
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/driver: avoid duplicate reply in GetStats()

Currently, dbus-broker replies to GetStats() with the connection
statistics, but then additionally sends a second AccessDenied reply.
Fix this by correctly returning success in the method-handler.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/driver: sort error-strings according to error-nums

Sort the error-string array the same way as the error-definitions to
make it easier to verify.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

Drop '#include <libaudit.h>' from src/util/apparmor.c

This header does not seem to be required.
Tested with -Dapparmor=true and -Daudit=true/-Daudit=false.

Bug: https://bugs.gentoo.org/873082
Signed-off-by: Mike Gilbert <floppym@gentoo.org>

Add missing log_append_here() when logging "Ready"

Signed-off-by: Marcus Sundberg <marcus.sundberg@aptilo.com>

build: add tarball signature instructions

Add instructions how to sign the release tarballs.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

build: prepare v32 release

Prepare the v32 release and update the NEWS date.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

build: adjust fuzzer coding style

Minor adjustments to the OSS-fuzz workflow, mainly to order keys
alphabetically in their local groups.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

ci: turn on CIFuzz

https://google.github.io/oss-fuzz/getting-started/continuous-integration/

Signed-off-by: Evgeny Vereshchagin <evvers@ya.ru>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: align unconfined with dbus-daemon

Align the handling of `unconfined` with dbus-daemon, so we do the same
as they do.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: align to coding-style

A rather big rewrite of the apparmor backend to convert from dbus-daemon
coding-style our own. A few bugs are fixed as well, hopefully none are
introduced.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: allow repeated calls to set_bus_type()

Allow repeated calls to set_bus_type() to set or clear previous types.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: inline fallback-context

Inline the fallback-context into the surrounding structure to simplify
alignment and allocation handling.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: avoid mixed declarations and code

Separate declarations from code to follow our internal coding-style.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: inline is_apparmor_enabled()

Inline this helper as it has an ambiguous name given that we already
have bus_apparmor_is_enabled().

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: update header comment

Update the header comment of the AppArmor backend to reflect the current
code status.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/driver: properly fold errors

Fix error-propagation across namespaces and fold errors correctly.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: sanitize header

Clean up the header and align it with our coding-style. This includes:

 * separte member functions logically with a new-line
 * properly pre-declare all defined types
 * prefix symbols with the module namespace
 * always include c-stdaux.h

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: drop spurious include

There is no reason to include error.h if it is not used. Drop it.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/apparmor: always update bustype on policy update

Make sure to always propagate the new bustype on policy updates to the
apparmor code to reflect the actual policy and let the AppArmor code
decide on what to do, rather than hard-coding the behavior outside.

Note that right now policy_registry_import() is only ever called on a
fresh policy object (and does not really work otherwise), but lets
pretend this can be used to update policies as well, just to hard-code
less of this behavior.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: add apparmor support

Add full AppArmor support using libapparmor. This requires af_unix
mediation support in the kernel (which has not yet landed upstream).

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/config: avoid parsing bus type

The bus type is usually "session" or "system", but can also be
a different arbitrary string. Avoid parsing it into an enum, so
that any non-standard bus type is allowed.

dbus-broker does not use the bus type itself, but it is propagated
to AppArmor security checks.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(make payload-names match enum-names; fix bus-type destructor)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

build: adjust v32 release

Adjust the release information to the recent changes and prepare for
the actual release again.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

build: add CodeQL based scanning

Add CodeQL based workflow to the repository enabling automatic
code-scans by Github-Actions.

Original-by: Frantisek Sumsal <frantisek@sumsal.cz>
(minor coding-style fixes and git-ref resolution)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

build: prepare v32 release

Bump version number, fill in changelog and synchronize AUTHORS.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

broker/controller: catch dynamic type-overflows as client error

Include C_DVAR_E_DEPTH_OVERFLOW in the possible client-errors when
decoding c-dvar. This is returned by newer c-dvar versions when nested
variants exceed the depth limits.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

tests: fix an fd leak

==365== FILE DESCRIPTORS: 6 open (3 std) at exit.
==365== Open AF_UNIX socket 7: <unknown>
==365==    at 0x4A4A8BB: socket (syscall-template.S:120)
==365==    by 0x40597C: util_broker_connect_fd (util-broker.c:558)
==365==    by 0x4033DC: test_fd_stream (test-fdstream.c:235)
==365==    by 0x403599: main (test-fdstream.c:284)
==365==
==365== Open AF_UNIX socket 6: <unknown>
==365==    at 0x4A4A8BB: socket (syscall-template.S:120)
==365==    by 0x40597C: util_broker_connect_fd (util-broker.c:558)
==365==    by 0x4033DC: test_fd_stream (test-fdstream.c:235)
==365==    by 0x403599: main (test-fdstream.c:284)
==365==
==365== Open AF_UNIX socket 5: <unknown>
==365==    at 0x4A4A8BB: socket (syscall-template.S:120)
==365==    by 0x40597C: util_broker_connect_fd (util-broker.c:558)
==365==    by 0x4033DC: test_fd_stream (test-fdstream.c:235)
==365==    by 0x403599: main (test-fdstream.c:284)

Signed-off-by: Evgeny Vereshchagin <evvers@ya.ru>

build: update maintenance makefile

Remove obsolete options from the maintenance makefile and synchronize
the help-entry.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

test/osi: drop unused and broken mkosi tests

The `mkosi` tool requires package-management tools to be installed on
the host. This is often not the case and cumbersome to use. Drop it for
now, since we have a replacement with the fedora container.

Note that the current mkosi arch-based configuration was long broken,
since it cannot properly setup the ArchLinux GPG keys due too overlong
paths. This means, no-one has been using this for years, anyway.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

test/image: add bootable fedora container

Add a bootable Fedora container to run test-builds in and verify basic
system operation.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/policy: provide security labels to rx check

Provide the sender and receiver security labels to the receive
policy check, so that they can be accessed by the AppArmor code.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(drop redundant recv->seclabel from *_check_receive())
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/policy: provide unique subject ID to rx/tx check

The dbus-daemon AppArmor implementation uses the unique ID when there
is no other subject name available. This exposes the unique ID to the
policy handling, so that it can be used by the AppArmor code that will
be added on top of this.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus/policy: add AppArmor access denied error

Introduce access denied policy error for bus operations denied
by AppArmor and handle it accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(for consistency check for the same errors everywhere)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: add optional libapparmor dependency

Add optional build support for libapparmor, which will be
required for proper AppArmor support.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(keep order in meson.build alphabetical; document apparmor-fallback.c)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

launch/config: read and propagate bus type

Read and propagate the DBus bus type from the config in preparation of
AppArmor support.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(adapt test-suite as well)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

bus: add AppArmor log policy

add bus log policy for AppArmor in preparation for adding proper
AppArmor support.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
(add selinux-clause to bus_log_append_policy_receive for consistency)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: avoid checking for EINVAL

Similar to *_is_enabled(), avoid checking for EINVAL. This again looks
like a copy/paste error from the proc.c code.

While at it, reduce the doc-string to <=80ch by simplifying the
description.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: add kernel support detection

Add code to detect if the kernel has AppArmor support for DBus
mediation, which is required for adding AppArmor support.
not yet available in the upstream kernel.

This uses the same kernel patch as dbus-daemon expecting, that
it will be upstreamed.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Reichel <sebastian.reichel@collabora.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david.rheinsberg@gmail.com>

util/apparmor: fix sysfs reader error handling

There is no reason to check for EINVAL in the fgets() case. This very
much looks like it was copy-pasted from the older proc.c code. Drop the
EINVAL check and simplify the error reporting. While at it, document why
we check for EINVAL in the proc.c code.
